  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet and torn inside of a salvage drum outside of Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Bottles were dented. One cap fell off. One was bent over. All 3 felt half empty. 4 one gallon bottles were indicated on box label. Three are indicated in system on FTrack. 3 were present with the box in the drum. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box and bottles were contained in a salvage drum when found.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet and torn inside of a Hazmat bag inside of the Hazmat cage. Original shipping label was not visible. Tracking number identified on OP-900 label. DescribePack: 4 one gallon bottles were indicated on box. 3 were present. All were wet. One was missing its cap and dented. Another was leaking from a puncture hole on the bottom. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading since package was contained in Hazmat bag. Bottles were placed into a salvage drum during inspection.

QA using appropriate PPE (face mask, gloves and goggles) took package in red, lined Hazmat Tote to cage for further processing. DescribePack: Top cap on package cracked and broke open. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright into Hazmat tote.

item.title: Report E-2023120133
item.description:
Report E-2023120133

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a UN1866 ELAN-Cast P 300 S RTC Low Odor release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of material released to the entire trailer floor as well as a 30’ x 20’ area of the concrete lot below due to the trailer wall puncturing the tote. The puncture was patched with wood to stop the release and the material was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. The free-standing liquid material was collected with a drum vac into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. Floor dry was then deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into a third 55-gallon metal drum. The punctured tote was patched with absorbent pads & chemical tape. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120031
item.description:
Report E-2023120031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, (1) box containing (2) 1-gallon bottles of Blue Whale Muriatic Acid (UN1789) became crushed as a result of inadequate preparation for transportation. During the off-loading process, the damaged, crushed product began leaking onto the concrete dock floor; a total amount of 1-gallon. A Contractor neutralized the release using Kolorsafe Liquid Acid Neutralizer before absorbing the liquid and containerizing the spill debris into the proper UN-rated shipping container (a vented 55-gallon fiber drum). Additionally, the pallet in which the load was shipped on was also cut-up and containerized for waste disposal. Lastly, the impacted box that the leaking bottles shipped in was neutralized and containerized for waste disposal. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacting by the release.

item.description:
Report X-2023120280

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Poor loading techniques led to the incident. Arrows were not facing upwards during loading. Once discovered, hazmat package was put inside of a hazardous material bucket and transported to he hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: No inner packaging to catch any spills. Caps were not tightly secured for transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: No spill was on the floor, only spilled onto the outer packaging, so the hazmat package was secured in a hazardous material bucket and placed in the designated hazmat spill staging area.

item.title: Report X-2023120271
item.description:
Report X-2023120271

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was poorly handled. Package was not loaded properly. Arrows were not upwards. DescribePack: No inner packaging for the hazardous liquid. item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 29, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN2966 released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the dock floor due to faulty packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads and Simple Green to wipe down the impacted dock floor and other pails of product. All spent absorbent pads, PPE, and any miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 5-gallon pail. The two (2) damaged pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon steel drum and staged onsite for disposal.

  • Description: On November 28, 2023, six (6) one-gallon pails of UN1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately 0.25-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the impacted site and re-palletized the non-damaged pails. The six (6) damaged pails and all UN1993-impacted debris were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for and staged onsite for facility disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel placed the two (2) damaged cans of UN1866 into one (1) 5-gallon pail. The impacted boxes were placed into one (1) additional 5-gallon pail. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found to be leaking on load side 3 by door 153. QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to avoid injury. DescribePack: The package was found to have loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to avoid injury.
